polimi.reds.broker.overlay
Class TCPTransport

java.lang.Object
  polimi.reds.broker.overlay.AbstractTransport
      polimi.reds.broker.overlay.TCPTransport
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Transport
public class TCPTransport
extends AbstractTransport
implements java.lang.Runnable

A transport using TCP to connect with neighboring brokers and standard Java serialization to marshal and unmarshal data.

Constructor Detail

TCPTransport

public TCPTransport()
             throws java.io.IOException
Creates a new TCPTransport that can be used to open connections toward other transports but does not accept incoming connections.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

TCPTransport

public TCPTransport(int port)
Creates a new TCPTransport capable of accepting new connections. The port parameter specifies the port this transport accepts connections from.

Parameters:
port - the port to use for accepting new connections.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

Starts this Transport. Transports must be started before performing every other operation.

setBeaconing

public void setBeaconing(boolean beaconing)
Description copied from interface: Transport
Activates and deactivates the beaconing mechanism to check the status of links. If beaconing is active the node requires data to arrive periodically to keep the connection alive and periodically send data.

Specified by:
setBeaconing in interface Transport
Overrides:
setBeaconing in class AbstractTransport
Parameters:
beaconing - true to enable the beaconing mechanism, false otherwise.

knowsProtocol

public boolean knowsProtocol(java.lang.String protocol)
Description copied from interface: Transport
Checks whether this transport knows the given protocol. This method can be used to decide if this transport is able to speak the given protocol, and consequently it can be used to open links toward a node identified by an URL characterized by such protocol.

Specified by:
knowsProtocol in interface Transport
Parameters:
protocol - the protocol to check.
Returns:
true if this transport knows the given protocol, false otherwise.

openLink

public Link openLink(java.lang.String url)
              throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                     java.net.ConnectException,
                     NotRunningException
Description copied from interface: Transport
Opens a new link with the node located at the specified URL. If everything goes right the new link is opened and the OpenLinkListeners registered are notified of the new link, otherwise an exception is thrown.

Specified by:
openLink in interface Transport
Parameters:
url - The URL of the node.
Returns:
The new link.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the url is not a valid REDS URL.
java.net.ConnectException - if the connection cannot be opened.
NotRunningException - if the transport is not running.

run

public void run()
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
